Method Detail

getNamingComponent

public static org.omg.CosNaming.NameComponent getNamingComponent(java.lang.String sn)
                                                          throws org.omg.CosNaming.NamingContextPackage.InvalidName
Get a name component from a string.

The string have the format A.B.C.D......; the id is the substring before the first dot; if we want an id with dot we use the escape character \, i.e.
  • A.B.C become [A, B.C];
  • A\.B.C become [A.B, C];
  • A.B\.C become [A, B.C];
Parameters:
propertyName - The name of the property.
Returns:
The name component representing the specified property.

stripSlash

public static java.lang.String stripSlash(java.lang.String source)

toName

public static org.omg.CosNaming.NameComponent[] toName(java.lang.String sn)
                                                throws org.omg.CosNaming.NamingContextPackage.InvalidName
Returns an a array of NameComponent for the NameService binding.

The string have the format A.B/C.D/......; each / delimit a NameComponent (or a NamingContext into the NameService); the escape character \ is used to ignoring the / charcter, i.e.
  • A.B/C.D become [[A, B],[C, D]];
  • A\.B/C.D become [[A.B, ],[C, D]];
  • A.B\/C.D become [[A, B/C.D]];
  • A\.B\/C.D become [[A.B/C, D]];

Bind the specified onject into the NameService following the specified path.
